episodes.title: Ep.19 Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God
episodes.description:
In the lush hills of Uganda during the 1980s and 90s, a new religious group claimed to offer clarity in a time of social and political upheaval. Calling themselves The Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God, the leaders preached a return to strict biblical law and obedience to visions of the Virgin Mary. At its heart were promises of purity, repentance, and survival of the coming apocalypse. But what began as a community of Marian visionaries and devout followers soon spiraled into secrecy, deprivation, and control. Members were forbidden to speak, forced into silence as a form of obedience. Prophecies of the end of the world kept believers loyal, even as leaders demanded more sacrifices of land, possessions, and absolute devotion. On the eve of the year 2000, when the world was preparing to celebrate a new millennium, tragedy struck. Instead of salvation, over 700 members of the movement perished in what at first looked like a mass suicide, but soon revealed signs of something even more sinister. This episode explores how the promise of divine protection became a tool for manipulation, and how one of the deadliest cult tragedies in modern history unfolded in near silence on the global stage.

Part 1 – Prophets in the Hills
Part 2 – Building the Ark
Part 3 – The Commandments Rewritten
Part 4 – Countdown to the End
Part 5 – The Fire of Kanungu
Part 6 – Ashes and Lessons

episodes.title: Ep.18 Synanon
episodes.description:
It began in 1958 as a radical experiment in recovery: a storefront in Santa Monica, a handful of addicts, and a tough-talking ex-alcoholic named Charles Dederich. What started as a lifeline for people desperate to break free from addiction soon grew into a powerful movement with thousands of members, sprawling compounds, and its own strict rules of life. Synanon promised transformation through brutal honesty and communal living, but the deeper people went, the harder it became to get out. In this episode, we follow Synanon’s journey from celebrated rehab innovation to infamous cult. We’ll explore the confrontational “Game” sessions, the charismatic but authoritarian leadership of Dederich, and the gradual shift from treatment community to closed society with its own laws and punishments. By the 1970s, Synanon had turned into something darker, complete with forced sterilizations, violent enforcement, and plots against its critics. Synanon’s story is not just about addiction and recovery. It’s about the dangerous line between salvation and control, and how a movement built on hope could twist into coercion and fear.

Part 1 – The Experiment Begins
Part 2 – The Game
Part 3 – The Utopia Vision
Part 4 – The Turn to Control
Part 5 – The Snake in the Mailbox
Part 6 – Echoes of Synanon

episodes.title: Ep.17 The Unification Church (The Moonies)
episodes.description: In this episode of Hidden Cults, we turn our attention to the Unification Church, more commonly known as “The Moonies.” Founded in Korea in the 1950s by Sun Myung Moon, the group grew into a global movement that promised spiritual salvation through “True Parents” but became infamous for its mass weddings, rigid hierarchy, and intense demands on followers. We explore Moon’s rise from post-war Korea to international notoriety, how the movement blended Christian language with unique theology, and why it attracted both devoted believers and harsh critics. Along the way, we examine the group’s vast financial empire, political connections, and the psychological toll on members caught between faith and control. The story of the Unification Church is one of devotion, manipulation, and the blurred line between religion and cult. It asks us to consider how charismatic leaders can reshape belief on a massive scale, and at what cost. episodes.title: Ep.16 Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
episodes.description:
The Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, or FLDS, is one of the most secretive and controversial offshoots of Mormonism. Built on the practice of polygamy long after the mainstream church abandoned it, the FLDS created isolated communities where obedience to leaders was absolute and individuality was erased. Under the rule of Warren Jeffs, the group became synonymous with forced marriages, child brides, and an authoritarian system that demanded complete loyalty. In this episode, we trace the history of the FLDS from its 20th-century roots to its transformation into a rigid theocracy. We’ll explore how its members were cut off from the outside world, how fear and devotion kept families in line, and how Jeffs rise to power ended with a dramatic downfall that exposed the inner workings of the sect. This is the story of a community built on faith, secrecy, and control, and the human cost of unquestioned devotion.

Part 2 – The Prophet’s Word
Part 3 – Building the Kingdom
Part 4 – Life Behind the Walls
Part 5 – Cracks in the Foundation

episodes.title: Ep.15 The 7M TikTok Cult
episodes.description: What looks like a dance collective on TikTok is, according to former members and family, something much darker. Behind the viral choreography and millions of views lies 7M Films, a management company run by Robert Shinn, a self-proclaimed pastor with a long history of spiritual control. Dancers who signed with 7M found their lives increasingly directed not just on stage, but in every personal decision, from finances and friendships to faith. Families watched their loved ones disappear into a world of rehearsals, prayers, and contracts that blurred the line between religion and business. In this episode, we trace how a Pentecostal church in Los Angeles transformed into a social media empire, why allegations of exploitation and manipulation continue to surface, and what the 7M story reveals about the rise of digital-age cults. episodes.title: Ep.13 The Narcosatanists (The Matamoros Cult)
episodes.description:
In 1989, a quiet ranch outside Matamoros, Mexico, revealed a nightmare. Police unearthed ritual altars, human remains, and evidence of a cult led by Adolfo Constanzo, a man who fused drug trafficking, black magic, and murder into a single reign of terror. Known to the world as the "Narcosatanists," (The Matamoros Cult) his followers believed blood and fear could grant them power and protection.
This episode of Hidden Cults takes you inside the rituals of Constanzo's secret world, the shocking discovery that made global headlines, and the legacy of belief and violence that refused to die.

episodes.title: Ep.11 The Rajneesh movement
episodes.description: They came to rural Oregon dressed in shades of orange and red, following a spiritual guru who rarely spoke and a powerful woman who did all the talking.
